biog.entry.name: HARTSUYKER, the Hon. Luke
biog.entry.description: Biography for HARTSUYKER, the Hon. Luke
biog.entry.electorate.name: Member for Cowper (NSW)
biog.entry.title: Biography for HARTSUYKER, the Hon. Luke
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Cowper (NSW)
biog.entry.party.name: Nationals

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Cowper, New South Wales, 2001, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Ageing from 20.3.02 to 31.8.04; Employment and Workplace Relations from 20.3.02 to 31.8.04 and from 11.3.08 to 10.11.08; Education and Vocational Training from 1.12.04 (Chair from 9.12.04) to 17.10.07; Privileges from 1.12.04 to 17.10.07; Procedure from 31.5.05 to 17.10.07; Economics from 3.2.10 to 19.7.10.
Joint Statutory: Corporations and Financial Services from 3.2.10 to 19.7.10.
Joint Standing: National Broadband Network from 22.3.11 to 5.8.13.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Member, Opposition Shadow Ministry from 6.12.07 to 18.9.13. Shadow Minister for Business Development, Independent Contractors and Consumer Affairs from 6.12.07 to 22.9.08; Shadow Minister for Competition Policy and Consumer Affairs from 22.9.08 to 8.12.09; Shadow Minister for Consumer Affairs, Financial Services, Superannuation and Corporate Law from 8.12.09 to 14.9.10; Shadow Minister for Youth and Sport from 14.9.10; Shadow Minister for Regional Communications from 14.9.10 to 18.9.13.
Deputy Manager of Opposition Business in the House from 6.12.07 to 18.9.13.
Deputy Leader of the House from 18.9.13.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: Associate Member, Certified Practising Accountants Australia.
Founding Board Member, Coffs Coast Tourism.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: New South Wales north coast; it includes the centres of Bellingen, Bowraville, Coffs Harbour, Dorrigo, Kempsey, Maclean, Macksville, Nambucca Heads, Sawtell, South West Rocks, Urunga and Woolgoolga.
Industries: fishing, forestry, agriculture, bananas, dairy cattle and tourism.
State electorates: Cowper includes the New South Wales Legislative Assembly electorate of Coffs Harbour, and parts of Clarence and Oxley.
